        About this item

        • HIGH-QUALITY NOISE REDUCTION – Packing up to 26 dB (SNR) of noise reduction, Loop Quiet Equinox helps you tune out the world and get in your bubble, perfect for sleep, focus, noise sensitivity and beyond. Loop Quiet Equinox earplugs qualify as certified hearing protection to keep your ears safe from damaging sounds.
        • COMFY, CUSTOMIZED FIT – Made from lightweight flexible silicone, these reusable earplugs offer unmatched comfort morning and night, even for side sleepers. Comes with 4 ear tip sizes (XS/S/M/L) for the perfect fit every time.
        • GREAT FOR SLEEP, FOCUS AND MORE – Loop Quiet Equinox earplugs offer instant noise reduction and protection for all kinds of situations. By reducing maximum background noise, Loop Quiet Equinox offers instant noise reduction for sleep, focus, relaxation, travel, noise sensitivity, travel and so much more.
        • EASY TO USE – Loop earplugs are easy to insert and come with adjustable ear tip sizes for optimal noise reduction and a comfortable fit throughout the day. Just pop them in, twist and enjoy your new volume. When inserted correctly, Loop earplugs should not stick out.
        • IN THE BOX – 1 set of Loop Quiet Equinox earplugs, 4 ear tip sizes (XS/S/M/L), 1 handy Carry Case. Loop earplugs are sustainable, easy to clean and last up to 5 years of daily use.

        Amazon Customer
        4 Stars
        They make a decent difference
        I like the design of the earplugs because they fit in my ears and provide noise reduction. I have small ears and required the xs tips. Although, I do wish I had the option to pick which sizes I wanted to try because I have no use for the M and L ear tips. I wonder if the xxs tips may provide any further comfort, but they come at an additional cost. I am able to sleep with them in my ears comfortably also.At first I found them difficult to insert because I don't usually use silicone earphones (because of my small ears), but once I realised that they do not need to go too deep into my ear canal to create a seal and stay in place, I found that the noise reduction was working. They do occasionally cause mild pressure pain, but not the the extent of foam plugs I have used in the past and it various.They make my partner's snoring sound quieter and make more bearable to sleep while he snores. It also helps to filter out odd sounds like doors shutting, and loud talking that would usually wake me up (I am a light sleeper).While I'm awake, I use them whilst studying/in the open-plan office or if my partner is playing music in the room; they help me to focus on what I am doing, so the sounds only seem like white noise. If he tries to talk to me, it is difficult to hear him clearly and I would have to take at least one ear plug out; his voice sounds like more of a muffled low frequency - but this is a good thing.Overall, I find them useful for ADHD to block out sound while sleeping or awake and I am happy with my purchase.

        AA
        4.0 out of 5 stars Review for ASD/SPD users
        Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 July 2021
        Verified Purchase
        After a lot of research I decided to buy these to see if they would help with daily sounds and noises that annoy me.

        Pros:
        • Once you get them in the right position in your ears, you can’t feel them and they don’t hurt.
        • The actual design of the loop that sits outside in your ear means I personally didn’t obsess about not being able to get them out easily/getting stuck etc.
        • They’re fairly subtle in your ears in comparison to other in-ear ear plugs or large noise cancelling headphones
        • Definitely work to smother background noises, it doesn’t get rid of them completely , I could still hear traffic or a child shouting and screaming etc outside but it wasn’t as harsh and annoyed me a lot less
        • Comes with a little case you can put them in when you need to take them out

        Cons:
        • They’re not the cheapest out there
        • If they’re not in your ear properly, they can be annoying and uncomfortable
        • I personally can’t eat with them in
        • They cancel noise almost too well at short range so I had to take them out to be able to concentrate on a conversation properly. I could still hear what was being said, but trying to focus on the one voice you’re trying to listen to while everything else is so muffled is difficult

        Overall for just sitting in the house watching tv etc on my own, I really like them and they work for me. If I’m trying to have a conversation with someone, I can’t hear the volume of my own voice and struggle to hold the conversation with them in. I plan on buying the Loop Experience ear plugs to see if they make having conversations easier but still muffle enough background noise.
        This is my opinion as someone on the Autism spectrum using them for sensory issues and I’m writing this to try and help those like me that came looking for the same thing but couldn’t find much useful information for specifically Autism use.

        L Rose
        3.0 out of 5 stars Fiddly and overpriced, but they do the job
        Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 January 2024
        Colour Name: Quiet SapphireVerified Purchase
        They look great - the ear plugs themselves, the carry case, and even the packaging are all nicely done. And they work as described; sound is muffled while you're wearing them, but not to the point that you won't hear an alarm going off in the night.

        For me that's where the positives end. It took me a long time to switch the tips - it's great that there are four different options, but actually attaching them was a nightmare; they don't want to sit flush to the plug like the pre-attached pair did, and with the smaller sizes the silicon is so tight it's really hard to make any adjustments. The carry case itself is also hard to open; not ideal if you reach for them in the night.

        I've worn them in bed once, and woke up to find one had fallen out. I daresay I had the wrong tip size, but I'll need to work up the patience to try and switch them again...!

        I think these are expensive for what they are - I guess you're paying for that nice packaging and the (fiddly) little carry case.

        Sandra A.
        4.0 out of 5 stars They make a decent difference
        Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 January 2024
        Verified Purchase
        I like the design of the earplugs because they fit in my ears and provide noise reduction. I have small ears and required the xs tips. Although, I do wish I had the option to pick which sizes I wanted to try because I have no use for the M and L ear tips. I wonder if the xxs tips may provide any further comfort, but they come at an additional cost. I am able to sleep with them in my ears comfortably also.

        At first I found them difficult to insert because I don't usually use silicone earphones (because of my small ears), but once I realised that they do not need to go too deep into my ear canal to create a seal and stay in place, I found that the noise reduction was working. They do occasionally cause mild pressure pain, but not the the extent of foam plugs I have used in the past and it various.

        They make my partner's snoring sound quieter and make more bearable to sleep while he snores. It also helps to filter out odd sounds like doors shutting, and loud talking that would usually wake me up (I am a light sleeper).

        While I'm awake, I use them whilst studying/in the open-plan office or if my partner is playing music in the room; they help me to focus on what I am doing, so the sounds only seem like white noise. If he tries to talk to me, it is difficult to hear him clearly and I would have to take at least one ear plug out; his voice sounds like more of a muffled low frequency - but this is a good thing.

        Overall, I find them useful for ADHD to block out sound while sleeping or awake and I am happy with my purchase.
